caption: Tiny Rossi Garden is one of those special spots in Paris where you just can't help but smile. In the afternoons, this cozy little garden turns into a lively dance floor, where people gather to dance and have a great time. It's like stepping into a scene from a movie!  The vibe here is incredibleâ€”everyone is so friendly, and you can feel the love for dancing in the air. Whether you're a seasoned dancer or just enjoy watching, it's impossible not to get caught up in the energy. The music, the laughter, and the rhythm of the dancing feet make it a perfect place to hang out and soak in some real Parisian joy.  The garden itself is lovely and peaceful, a great spot to relax. But when the dancing starts, itâ€™s pure magic. If you're looking for a unique experience in Paris, youâ€™ve got to check out Tiny Rossi Garden. You might even find yourself joining in!
A small garden with outdoor modern sculptures along the Seine and near the zoo with lots of seating and a small playground for toddlers. Nice break from the hectic and busy city.
Beautiful jardin near the Notre Dame area and Pont Neuf bridge. Itâ€™s very walkable and beautiful view to the seine river.

Went here to watch the French tango by the river and it was absolutely amazing. Sitting by the river in the sun is great as it is, but watching the dancing made it a whole new experience. Very nice community feel from the locals dancing and those watching and cheering on. It was beautiful to be a part of it. Also witnessed someone propose in that very spot after a dance which was amazing to see and it shows that this spot is highly valued.

We dreamt of dancing on the Seine and this location made our dreams come true! There were two areas both with a large speaker for recorded music, one with Argentine tango and the other with fun salsa dancing and even a guy giving lessons!

A summer in Paris must lead you to this place
Very nice garden to walk and enjoy the seine.
Hidden treasure in Paris where you can dance on salsa music, guinguette, or listen to small orchestras
Go on an evening when they are dancingâ€¦ magical.
I was there for a Milonga at the dancing spots at the Quai de Seine ... Dj La Bailarina flawless ðŸŽ¶ â€¦
Awesome place to experience the authentic Paris. If you like dance, make sure you pay a visit. There's outdoor milongas(tango), salsa, swing for free, anybody can join.
Every summer I go there to dance on the Quais Saint Bernard. You can dance Salsa, bachata, Kizomba, Swing and enjoy a wonderful evening with friends by doing a picnic :D
Amazing views, beautiful place.
Nice,, needs care.. some of the plants and trees are sad.

The park is nice for a walk by the Seine. People practicing dancing - this is somewhat amusing. Convenient pee restrooms, no small kiosks for refreshments. Boating limited to a 60â‚¬ day pass. No one hour options. It is a pity. Ticket box with dark windows and not friendly.
Good garden with nice playing area for 2-6 years old kids
Great design waterfront scroll.
Nice place for a walk or picnic
Beautiful garden to walk around in the afternoon

This place is like weekend getaway for the locals. Quite romantic and it's a nice place to chill out with a drink with no disturbance from police or any other elements. Safe for family and visiting during night is fun. With some live music in the surrounding .
During summer, that's the place to go if you want to dance outside :)
From June to August you're bound to find people gathering at this park to dance. It doesn't cost a cent but you've got to keep an eye out. So fun, you should join.
Cool place to dance tango, salsa, merengue and reggaeton, next to the seine ! Best urban mood you'll get in a fancy city like this Paris !
Perfect spot for an evening walk at the Seine watch the people dancing to different styles.
Perfect urban park alongside the Seine. Lots of grass, trees, public art, people dancing tango, riding bikes, relaxing, vibe is so positive w/view of the Seine. An oasis in the middle of Paris.
Amazing place in Paris. Small but calm. Island of paradise in the busy city
Excellent place to learn and dancing ðŸ’ƒ Salsa, Tango and rock & roll. â€¦
Magic spot on the water...for jogging...walking...relaxing...partying....dancing.....especially at night with the carroussel of boats crossing along
That's was beautiful, I'm looking forward to coming back again, for real,  thanks to the DJ Saidou it was amazing!
Great views, people gently partying and dancing to the music, less crowded than the other side.
Great view of the seine from an open air spot, a great place full of life but it's not safe late night on Saturdays.
Itâ€™s nice to be with a beautiful view of the Seine. A friendly environment. Suitable for a pic nic with friends
We attended a tango milonga in this park and it was an absolute delight.
The real spot for seeing/listening some street music and dancing, really funny and interesting place
Nice experience dancing in the summer by the river.
Quite a nice place to relax for a bit. There is music and dance nearby.
Not enough variety of dances, but still entertaining
